resources.string:
Login Page Guide

 1. Getting Started:
 • Enter your registered email address
 • Enter your password
 • Click the Login button

 2. New User?
 • Click "Register" at the bottom to create a new account
 • Choose User or Developer role during registration

 3. Forgot Password?
 • Click the "Forgot Password?" link
 • Follow the instructions to reset your password

 4. Master Account:
 • Master users have special privileges
 • Contact system admin for master credentials

User Dashboard Guide

 1. Create Plan:
 • Search for routes by origin and destination
 • Filter by transport type (Bus/Train)
 • Add multiple legs to create a journey
 • Save your travel plan for future reference

 2. Saved Plans:
 • View all your saved travel plans
 • Tap on a plan to see details
 • Edit or delete plans as needed

 3. Route Finder:
 • Quick search for available routes
 • Enter origin and destination cities
 • Select date and transport type
 • View schedules with timings and fares

 4. Navigation Tips:
 • Use the back button to return to previous screen
 • Tap + button to create new plans
 • Logout when finished using the app

Developer Dashboard Guide

 1. Manage Schedules:
 • Add new bus/train schedules
 • Update departure and arrival times
 • Set fare information and seat availability
 • Delete outdated schedules

 2. Manage Routes:
 • Create new routes between cities
 • Update route information
 • Set transport type for routes
 • Delete unused routes

 3. My Requests:
 • View your pending schedule/route requests
 • Check approval status
 • Resubmit rejected requests

 4. Route Finder:
 • Search and verify routes in the system
 • Test route availability for users

 5. Best Practices:
 • Submit accurate schedule information
 • Keep schedules up to date
 • Wait for master approval before changes go live

Master Dashboard Guide

 1. Account Approvals:
 • Review pending user registrations
 • Approve or reject new accounts
 • Verify user credentials before approval

 2. Manage Users:
 • View all system users
 • Change user roles (User/Developer/Master)
 • Lock/unlock user accounts
 • Monitor user activity

 3. Request History:
 • View all schedule/route requests
 • Track approval/rejection history
 • Audit system changes

 4. Route Finder:
 • Monitor available routes in the system
 • Verify schedule accuracy

 5. Master Responsibilities:
 • Maintain system integrity
 • Ensure data quality
 • Handle user management carefully
 • Review developer submissions promptly
 • Keep audit logs for accountability
